grammatical_notes: Used attached to an abbreviated form (e.g., jan-) of the substantive (e.g., jána 'lengua') that functions as the complement of the suffix. Used about body parts. -NTO, -OMA are used with the same sense of 'sin', but -OMA is used without restriction, while -NTO is limited in its application to body parts. Thus, for example, the two forms jindoma and jínto are found that mean 'without tail'.

definitions_spanish: Esta mujer está resentida porque doña Lucila no le dio chaquiras.
definitions_english: This woman is resentful because Mrs. Lucila didn't give her beads.

examples.shipibo: Nato tšára jahuen noyá jacóma iqui.
examples.spanish: El vuelo de este pajarito es feo.
examples.english: The flight of this little bird is ugly.

examples.spanish: Mal a unas crías de garza que ya sabían volar.
examples.english: Bad for some heron chicks that already knew how to fly.

grammatical_notes: Used about birds of fowl or something airborne. The adjective indicates that one already knows how to fly.

etymology: [del ship. nótsiji resentir + -n, sf. de derivación vbl.]

examples.shipibo: Rócotonra jóni noísinque, jahuen báque ránenyamaara mahuámaquetian.
examples.spanish: El doctor riñó a un hombre porque no hizo curar a su hijo y lo dejó morir.
examples.english: The doctor scolded a man because he didn't have his son treated and let him die.
I don't want to receive the sip.

examples.shipibo: Nato šhóntacora yóaši icašh nato yápa jëne nošhó acášhamai.
examples.spanish: La señorita no quiere beber el caldo que los otros han sorbido porque no está dispuesta a compartir su comida.
examples.english: The young lady doesn't want to drink the broth that the others have sipped because she is not willing to share her food.

grammatical_notes: Used without modifier to specify which is the sorbido liquid.

etymology: [del ship. no- en el abdomen + šhócuti pelar]
definitions_spanish: pelar o despellejar por el abdomen
definitions_english: to peel or skin from the abdomen

definitions_spanish: enfadarse (por ejemplo, al no recibir lo que se quiere)
definitions_english: to get angry (for example, at not receiving what one wants)

examples.shipibo: Máloshiain cácasainbi jahuen papán ráanyamaara báque nótsique.
examples.spanish: El niño se echó a patalear de rabia porque su padre no le dejó ir a Pucallpa.
examples.english: The child began to kick in anger because his father didn't let him go to Pucallpa.

examples.shipibo: Páan bícasainbi méntamacanaara nato báque šhontaco nótsique.
examples.spanish: Esta muchacha se enfadó porque no le dieron el pan que quería recibir.
examples.english: This girl got angry because they didn't give her the bread she wanted to receive.

examples.shipibo: Jahuen tïtán bóyamaara nato báque nótsique.
examples.spanish: Este niño está enfadado porque su mamá no lo llevó consigo.
examples.english: This child is angry because his mother didn't take him along.

examples.spanish: Cuando una mujer está resentida con su esposo, no quiere conversar con él.
examples.english: When a woman is resentful with her husband, she doesn't want to talk with him.

examples.spanish: Cuentan que los dos hijos de un hombre se convirtieron en huancahuís y volaron.
examples.english: They say that a man's two sons turned into huancahuis and flew away.

examples.shipibo: Póirito Cayáoainanti mëstíora náhua aínbo mahuáque, ipo jëne šhána nóšhoash.
examples.spanish: Una mestiza de Puerto Callao murió por sorber caldo de chuchama muy caliente.
examples.english: A mestiza woman from Puerto Callao died from sipping very hot chuchama broth.

etymology: [del ship. no- en el ombligo + šháteti cortar]
definitions_english: to cut the umbilical cord of

definitions_spanish: nombre de la letra o en el alfabeto shipibo
definitions_english: name of the letter o in the Shipibo alphabet

grammatical_notes: Used as an exclamation, e.g., for surprise or for something just remembered.
